title: Calories in Risotto
meta_description: Learn calories in risotto per 200g serving, plus carbs, protein, fat, full nutrition facts, and recipe tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Cooked risotto with arborio rice, vegetable broth, onion, butter, and parmesan; basic recipe without meat or extra vegetables; approx. 1 cup serving.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, ingredients, portion size, and cooking method. Check labels or recipes for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A 200g serving of risotto provides ~300 kcal, mainly from carbs with moderate fat and protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of risotto?
faqs.a: About 300 kcal in a 200g serving of basic risotto.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in risotto?
faqs.a: Around 50g carbs in 200g, mostly from rice.
Moderate at 8g protein per 200g serving; add meat or cheese to boost.

faqs.q: How does risotto compare to plain rice calories?
faqs.a: Higher due to added fat and cheese; plain cooked rice is ~130 kcal per 100g.
Yes, use less butter/oil and more veggies to reduce to under 250 kcal per serving.
